title: Airlines Scramble for Routes Around Russia as Flight Bans Intensify
sub_head: Avoiding Russian airspace likely to increase costs for passengers and cargo, further snarling global supply chains
body:
Airlines world-wide are altering routes and canceling flights to avoid Russian airspace, changes that will lengthen journey times and raise costs for carriers that were starting to bounce back from their pandemic slump.
With Russia banning many European airlines from its skies, flying around the giant country may add hundreds of miles and up to two hours to some flights, incurring higher fuel, labor and maintenance costs, according to airlines and analysts. That could translate into higher fares and cargo rates, throwing another wrench in the worldâ€™s disrupted global supply chains.
